Dear,

This is reference to your application and the subsequent interview you had with us. We are pleased to appoint you as
in our business on the following terms and conditions of your appointment.

1.1 You are required to join the services of the company on or before
. If you fail to report to duty on or before the joining date, you will be deemed not to have joined the company and this appointment letter will be considered withdrawn/cancelled without any further liability.
1.2 At the time of joining, you are requested to furnish copies of your educational qualifications, testimonials, and a relieving letter from your previous organization. This offer is also subject to you not being under any contractual obligation that prevents you from accepting this offer or starting work on the date of joining.
1.3 In case you do not submit the required documents within 30 days from your date of joining, the company shall be constrained to hold back your salary until such documents are furnished.

2.1 Your initial place of posting shall be at Vizag.
2.2 You will be liable to transfer in such capacity as the company may from time to time determine to any other location or department. In such case, you will be governed by the terms and conditions of services applicable to the new assignment.

3.1 You will be on a probation period of 6 months from the date of joining, and your confirmation will be subject to satisfactory completion of the probation period.
3.2 During the probation period, your employment is terminable by either party by giving 15 day's notice.

4.1 During the course of your employment and by virtue of the position held by you, you shall keep and maintain strict confidentiality of all information and data.
4.2 Upon expiry or termination of your employment with the company, you must return and surrender to your supervisor all such confidential information, including but not limited to data, files, books, reports, and records.
4.3 You shall not disclose any such information to the public or in any media, public papers, or journals.
4.4 You are required to adhere to and comply with the company's information security policy at all times.
5.1 You will also participate in the company's incentive plan as applicable to your role. The plan will be communicated to you by your management.
6.1 Your work timings will be as per the Company rules pertaining to the stores to which you are currently attached.

7.1 Your appointment and continued employment with the company is strictly based on consistently delivering performance as per agreed parameters and business targets.
7.2 Absenteeism: If you absent yourself without leave or remain absent beyond the period of granted or extended leave, you shall be considered as having voluntarily terminated your employment unless:

ul.li: You return to work within 7 working days from the commencement of such absence; and
You provide a satisfactory explanation to the Management for the absence.
If you are found medically unfit to continue the job, you may be terminated from employment.

div.p:
7.3 Harassment: The company considers harassment and discrimination of any nature to be unacceptable behavior and it will not be tolerated under any circumstance.
7.4 Disciplinary action, including termination of employment, will be taken against anyone found guilty of harassment or discrimination against a fellow employee.

8.1 You will retire from the services of the Company upon attaining the age of 58 years or such retirement age as may be decided by the Management.
8.2 This contract of employment is terminable by either party with a 60 day's (2 months) notice period.
The company shall have the right to terminate your employment without notice if:

ul.li: You become insolvent or bankrupt, or are charged with a criminal offence that is prejudicial to the interests of the company.
You commit any material breach of your duties and responsibilities under this contract.
You are involved in harassment at the workplace.

You are found in violation of any of your obligations under the general terms and conditions of employment and the Code of Conduct as outlined in Annexure 1. The company's opinion in such matters shall be final and binding.

div.p: Misconduct includes but is not limited to:

ol.li: Wilful insubordination or disobedience, whether alone or with others, to any lawful and reasonable order of the superior, including refusal to accept transfer.
Theft, fraud, or dishonesty in connection with the company's business or property.
Wilful damage to or causing loss of goods or property.
Taking or giving bribe or commission for purchases/contracts made on behalf of the company.
Remaining absent without information for more than 7 consecutive working days.
Habitual late attendance, leaving the workplace early, or being absent from the place of work without permission.
Entering or remaining within the company premises except on duty or without authorization.
Riotous behavior during working hours or any act subversive of discipline.
Refusal to work regular office hours while on the premises or disrupting co-workers.
Engaging in private work or trade within the company premises or holding other employment for profit without written permission from the company.
Displaying or distributing within the company premises any bills, pamphlets, placards, posters, or banners.
Disclosing any confidential information obtained during the course of employment without authorization.
Reporting to work under the influence of liquor.
Conviction by a court of law for any criminal offence involving moral turpitude.
Quarrelling, fighting, or using abusive language within company premises.
Misbehaving with customers or contractors of the company.

Engaging in sexual harassment of any employee during or outside working hours. Sexual harassment includes:
Physical contact and advances
Demand or request for sexual favours
Sexually colored remarks
Unwelcome physical, verbal or non-verbal conduct of a sexual nature causing annoyance to co-workers, vendors, or customers

div.p: The company may revise the terms and conditions from time to time in its best interest.
We look forward to your joining and wish you a rewarding and successful career with us.
